lustre/tests/rename_many.c

00034 
00035 #define PATH_LENGTH 35
00036 #include <math.h>
00037 #include <signal.h>
00038 #include <unistd.h>
00039 #include <time.h>
00040 #include <sys/types.h>
00041 #include <sys/stat.h>
00042 #include <stdio.h>
00043 #include <fcntl.h>
00044 #include <stdlib.h>
00045 #include <getopt.h>
00046 
00047 struct names {
00048         char from[PATH_LENGTH];
00049         char to[PATH_LENGTH];
00050 } *names;
00051 
00052 unsigned int loop_count = 500;
00053 int file_count = 1000;
00054 int seed;
00055 int loops;
00056 int stop;
00057 long start;
00058 
00059 int opt_exit_on_err;
00060 int opt_verbose;
00061 int opt_create_only;
00062 int opt_rename_only;
00063 int creat_errors;
00064 int rename_errors;
00065 int unlink_errors;
00066 
00067 void usage(const char *progname)
00068 {
00069         fprintf(stderr, "usage: %s [-n numfiles] [-s seed] [-v] [-x] [dir]\n"
00070                 "\t-c: only do the create step of first loop\n"
00071                 "\t-f: number of files to create/rename/unlink per loop\n"
00072                 "\t-n: number of test loops (0 to run forever)\n"
00073                 "\t-r: only do the rename step of first loop\n"
00074                 "\t-s: starting seed (equals loop number by default)\n"
00075                 "\t-v: verbose\n"
00076                 "\t-x: don't exit on error\n", progname);
00077 }
00078 
00079 void handler(int sig) {
00080         static long last_time;
00081         long now = time(0);
00082 
00083         signal(SIGINT, handler);
00084         signal(SIGALRM, handler);
00085         printf("%6lds %8d iterations %d/%d/%d errors",
00086                now - start, loops, creat_errors, rename_errors, unlink_errors);
00087         if (sig != 0)
00088                 printf(" - use SIGQUIT (^\\) or ^C^C to kill\n");
00089         else
00090                 printf("\n");
00091 
00092         if (sig == SIGQUIT)
00093                 stop = 1;
00094         else if (sig == SIGINT) {
00095                 if (now - last_time < 2)
00096                         stop = 1;
00097                 last_time = now;
00098         }
00099         alarm(60);
00100 }
00101 
00102 extern char *optarg;
00103 extern int optind;
00104 
00105 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00106 {
00107         unsigned long n;
00108         char msg[100], *end = NULL;
00109         int h1, h2;
00110         int i, c;
00111 
00112         while ((c = getopt(argc, argv, "cf:n:rs:vx")) != EOF) {
00113                 switch(c) {
00114                 case 'c':
00115                         ++opt_create_only;
00116                         break;
00117                 case 'f':
00118                         i = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00119                         if (i && end != NULL && *end == '\0') {
00120                                 file_count = i;
00121                         } else {
00122                                 fprintf(stderr, "bad file count '%s'\n",optarg);
00123                                 usage(argv[0]);
00124                                 return 1;
00125                         }
00126                         break;
00127                 case 'n':
00128                         i = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00129                         if (i && end != NULL && *end == '\0') {
00130                                 loop_count = i;
00131                         } else {
00132                                 fprintf(stderr, "bad loop count '%s'\n",optarg);
00133                                 usage(argv[0]);
00134                                 return 1;
00135                         }
00136                         break;
00137                 case 'r':
00138                         ++opt_rename_only;
00139                         break;
00140                 case 's':
00141                         i = strtoul(optarg, &end, 0);
00142                         if (end && *end == '\0') {
00143                                 seed = i;
00144                         } else {
00145                                 seed = random();
00146                                 fprintf(stderr, "using random seed %u\n", seed);
00147                         }
00148                         break;
00149                 case 'v':
00150                         ++opt_verbose;
00151                         break;
00152                 case 'x':
00153                         ++opt_exit_on_err;
00154                         break;
00155                 default:
00156                         usage(argv[0]);
00157                         return 1;
00158                 }
00159         }
00160 
00161         names = malloc(sizeof(struct names) * file_count);
00162         if (names == NULL) {
00163                 perror("calloc");
00164                 return(1);
00165         }
00166 
00167         h2 = sprintf(msg, "%x", file_count); /* just to figure length */
00168         h1 = (PATH_LENGTH - h2 - 2) / 4;
00169 
00170         n = (1ULL << h1 * 4) - 1;
00171 
00172         //printf("h1 = %d, h2 = %d n = %lu\n", h1, h2, n);
00173 
00174         start = time(0);
00175 
00176         signal(SIGQUIT, handler);
00177         signal(SIGINT, handler);
00178         signal(SIGALRM, handler);
00179         signal(SIGUSR1, handler);
00180         alarm(60);
00181 
00182         if (argc > optind + 1) {
00183                 fprintf(stderr, "too many extra args %d\n", argc - optind);
00184                 usage(argv[0]);
00185                 return 1;
00186         } else if (argv[optind] != NULL) {
00187                 if (chdir(argv[optind]) < 0) {
00188                         snprintf(msg, sizeof(msg),
00189                                  "chdir '%s'\n", argv[optind]);
00190                         perror(msg);
00191                         return 2;
00192                 }
00193         }
00194 
00195         while (!stop && loop_count != 0 && loops < loop_count) {
00196                 int j,k,l,m;
00197 
00198                 srand(seed + loops);
00199                 if (mkdir("tmp", S_IRWXU) == -1) {
00200                         perror("mkdir tmp");
00201                         return(1);
00202                 }
00203                 if (chdir("tmp") == -1) {
00204                         perror("chdir tmp");
00205                         return(1);
00206                 }
00207 
00208                 for (i = 0; i < file_count ; i++) {
00209                         j = random() & n;
00210                         k = random() & n;
00211                         l = random() & n;
00212                         m = random() & n;
00213                         sprintf(names[i].from, "%0*x%0*x%0*x%0*x0%0*x",
00214                                 h1, j, h1, k, h1, l, h1, m, h2, i);
00215                         sprintf(names[i].to, "%0*x%0*x%0*x%0*x1%0*x",
00216                                 h1, j, h1, k, h1, l, h1, m, h2, i);
00217 
00218                 }
00219 
00220                 for (i = 0; i < file_count; i++) {
00221                         if (mknod(names[i].from, S_IFREG | S_IRWXU, 0) == -1) {
00222                                 sprintf(msg, "loop %d.%d: creat %s",
00223                                         loops, i, names[i].from);
00224                                 perror(msg);
00225                                 creat_errors++;
00226                                 if (!opt_exit_on_err)
00227                                         return 4;
00228                         }
00229                 }
00230 
00231                 if (opt_create_only)
00232                         return 0;
00233 
00234                 for (i = 0; i < file_count; i++) {
00235                         if (rename(names[i].from, names[i].to) == -1) {
00236                                 sprintf(msg, "loop %d.%d: rename %s to %s",
00237                                         loops, i, names[i].from, names[i].to);
00238                                 perror(msg);
00239                                 rename_errors++;
00240                                 if (!opt_exit_on_err)
00241                                         return 4;
00242                         }
00243                 }
00244 
00245                 if (opt_rename_only)
00246                         return 0;
00247 
00248                 for (i = 0; i < file_count; i++) {
00249                         if (unlink(names[i].to) == -1) {
00250                                 sprintf(msg, "loop %d.%d: unlink %s",
00251                                         loops, i, names[i].to);
00252                                 perror(msg);
00253                                 unlink_errors++;
00254                                 if (!opt_exit_on_err)
00255                                         return 4;
00256                         }
00257                 }
00258 
00259                 if (chdir("..") == -1) {
00260                         perror("chdir ..");
00261                         return(1);
00262                 }
00263 
00264                 if (rmdir("tmp") == -1) {
00265                         if (chdir("tmp") == -1) {
00266                                 perror("chdir tmp 2");
00267                                 return(1);
00268                         }
00269                         for (i = 0; i < file_count; i++) {
00270                                 if (unlink(names[i].from) != -1) {
00271                                         fprintf(stderr, "loop %d.%d: "
00272                                                 "unexpected file %s\n",
00273                                                 loops, i, names[i].to);
00274                                         unlink_errors++;
00275                                         if (!opt_exit_on_err)
00276                                                 return 4;
00277                                 }
00278                         }
00279                         if (chdir("..") == -1) {
00280                                 perror("chdir .. 2");
00281                                 return(1);
00282                         }
00283                         if (rmdir("tmp") == -1) {
00284                                 perror("rmdir tmp");
00285                                 return(1);
00286                         }
00287                 }
00288 
00289                 loops++;
00290                 if (opt_verbose)
00291                         handler(0);
00292         }
00293 
00294         if (!opt_verbose)
00295                 handler(0);
00296         return(0);
00297 }
